{"step_by_step_thinking": "The active form of vitamin D in the kidney is produced through a two-step process. First, vitamin D is converted to 25 hydroxy cholecalciferol in the liver. Then, in the kidney, 25 hydroxy cholecalciferol is further converted to the active form, which is 1, 25 dihydroxy cholecalciferol. Therefore, the correct answer is C. 1, 25 dihydroxy cholecalciferol.", "answer_choice": "C"}
